news_header: Friedrich Merz is likely to become German Chancellor and advocates for 50 gas-fired power stations.
news_text: Friedrich Merz, President of the Christian Democratic Union of Germany, is expected to become the next German Chancellor following early Bundestag elections on February 23. He has called for the rapid construction of 50 gas-fired power stations to address energy shortages, particularly after a period of low wind power generation and the recent closure of nuclear power stations under Chancellor Scholz's leadership.
